title: Carousel Remote - Comprehensive Usage Examples
description: Remote control for any carousel using unique ID connection. Features prev/next navigation buttons, customizable dot indicators with icons/images, tooltips, pagination display, and extensive styling options.

examples.name: Basic Prev/Next Buttons (Centered)
examples.description: Simple navigation with text and FontAwesome icons, centered alignment
examples.visualDescription: Blue buttons with white chevron icons and 'Previous'/'Next' text, centered horizontally, rounded corners, hover state darkens background
examples.useCase: Product image carousels, general content sliders, basic navigation needs
examples.carouselIdNote: The carouselId 'product-carousel-main' must exactly match the carouselId set in the target tpgb/tp-carousel or tpgb/tp-anything-carousel block. This is case-sensitive!

examples.name: Icon-Only Buttons (No Text)
examples.description: Large arrow icons without button text, purple gradient background
examples.visualDescription: Circular buttons with large arrow icons only (no text), purple gradient background, positioned left/right, hover scales up slightly
examples.useCase: Hero sliders, full-width image carousels, minimal design aesthetics
examples.responsiveNotes: Button padding reduces from 18px (desktop) → 14px (tablet) → 12px (mobile) to maintain appropriate touch targets without overwhelming small screens
examples.ariaRequired: CRITICAL: When btntxt1 and btntxt2 are empty, pAriaLabel and nAriaLabel are REQUIRED for accessibility. Screen readers need these labels to announce button purpose.

examples.name: Horizontal Dots with Animated Border (Style-1)
examples.description: 5 product dots with FontAwesome icons, animated purple border on active
examples.visualDescription: Row of 5 circular dots with shopping bag icons, gray background, active dot has animated purple border that fills over 3 seconds, horizontal layout below carousel
examples.useCase: E-commerce product galleries, image showcases, portfolio carousels

dotListNotes.repeater: dotList is a repeater array - add/remove items to match carousel slide count
dotListNotes._keyRequired: Each dot item MUST have unique _key value (0, 1, 2, etc.)
dotListNotes.iconConsistency: Keep iconName consistent across all dots for uniform appearance, or use different icons per dot for visual distinction

examples.style1BorderAnimation: AniDuration in milliseconds (3000 = 3 seconds). Border animates around active dot over this duration. Sync with carousel autoplay speed for visual feedback. Set to '' to disable animation.
examples.borderColorNote: AborderColor sets the animated border color for style-1. Default purple (#6f14f1) matches brand color.

examples.name: Vertical Dots with Tooltips (Style-2)
examples.description: 4 testimonial dots with user icons and name tooltips on hover
examples.visualDescription: Vertical column of 4 dots on the right side, each with user icon, tooltips appear on left hover showing customer names, white tooltips with arrows, active dot has blue background
examples.useCase: Testimonial sliders, customer review carousels, team member showcases

style2TooltipNotes.tooltipDirection: Use vtooltipDir for vertical layouts (left/right make sense), tooltipDir for horizontal layouts (top/bottom make sense)
style2TooltipNotes.labelVisibility: label text appears in tooltip on hover, not visible by default
style2TooltipNotes.arrowAlignment: tooltiparrow=true shows CSS arrow pointing to dot, arrowColor must match totipBgcolor for seamless appearance

examples.layoutConsiderations: Vertical dots work best on sidebar of carousel. Place this block in a column next to the carousel for side-by-side layout.

examples.name: Custom Image Icons for Dots
examples.description: Team member thumbnails as dot icons with tooltips
examples.visualDescription: Horizontal row of 3 dots with circular team member photo thumbnails, hover shows name tooltip above, active member has colored border, photos are 60×60px rounded
examples.useCase: Team member carousels, author bios, speaker showcases, expert profiles

imageIconNotes.iconFontsValue: Set iconFonts to 'img' (not 'font_awesome') to use custom images
imageIconNotes.iconImage: Provide WordPress media object with url and id. Use iconimageSize to control WordPress thumbnail size (thumbnail, medium, large, full)
imageIconNotes.dimgSize: Controls max-width of image in pixels. Set smaller than dotSize to leave padding/border room
imageIconNotes.imagePadding: dpadding adds internal spacing between image and dot border (5px recommended for visible border)

imageSizeRecommendations.optimizeTip: Use WordPress thumbnail size (150×150) then control display size with dimgSize for best performance

examples.borderVisibility: Active dot background (actdotBgtype) acts as colored border when image is smaller than dot size. 5px padding shows 5px border around image.

examples.name: Full Control Panel (All Features)
examples.description: Complete remote with buttons, 4 dots, and pagination counter
examples.visualDescription: Centered layout with prev/next buttons on sides, 4 horizontal dots in middle with icons, pagination '2 / 4' below dots, all elements styled cohesively in blue theme
examples.useCase: Featured content sliders, premium showcases, high-visibility carousels

layoutBreakdown.buttons: Left: Prev button | Center: Dots + Pagination | Right: Next button
layoutBreakdown.buttonSpacing: btnSpace 120px desktop creates wide gap for centered dots, reduces to 40px mobile for compact layout

paginationNotes.sliderInd: Separator between current/total (e.g., ' / ' shows '2 / 4', '-' shows '2-4', 'of' shows '2of4')
paginationNotes.noTypo: Typography for total page count (lighter gray)
paginationNotes.ActnoTypo: Typography for active page number (darker, bolder for emphasis)

examples.buttonSpaceResponsive: CRITICAL: btnSpace must be large enough (120px desktop) to fit dots + pagination in the center gap between buttons. Reduce on mobile to prevent overflow.

examples.name: Mobile-Friendly Vertical Dots (Right Sidebar)
examples.description: Compact vertical dots optimized for mobile carousel sidebars
examples.visualDescription: Small vertical dots on right edge of carousel, simple circles without icons, gray inactive, blue active, minimal spacing for mobile screens
examples.useCase: Mobile-first carousels, touch-friendly galleries, compact layouts

mobileOptimizations.noIcons: iconName set to empty string creates simple circular dots without icons (cleaner, less visual clutter)
mobileOptimizations.smallDots: 24px mobile dot size meets minimum 24×24px touch target (WCAG 2.5.5 level AAA recommends 44×44, but 24 acceptable for secondary controls)
mobileOptimizations.compactSpacing: 8px spacing between dots on mobile saves vertical space
mobileOptimizations.noAnimation: AniDuration empty string disables border animation for simpler mobile UX

examples.placementTip: Place this block in a narrow column (20-30% width) next to carousel column (70-80% width) for sidebar dot navigation. Use tp-row and tp-column blocks for layout.

examples.name: Minimalist Pagination Only
examples.description: Clean pagination counter without buttons or dots
examples.visualDescription: Simple centered text showing '1 of 8', no buttons or dots, clean typography with active number in bold purple, total count in gray
examples.useCase: Blog post sliders, article carousels, minimal design aesthetics, progress indicators
examples.typographyDifference: Active number (ActnoTypo) is larger (20px) and bolder (700) than total (noTypo 16px, 400) to emphasize current position. Color contrast also helps (purple vs gray).
examples.whenToUse: Use pagination-only when carousel auto-rotates and user doesn't need manual navigation (buttons/dots), or when space is extremely limited. Good for awareness of progress without interaction.

validationRules.carouselId: REQUIRED - Must exactly match the carouselId attribute in the target tpgb/tp-carousel or tpgb/tp-anything-carousel block (case-sensitive)
validationRules.carobtn: If true, buttons will render. Set false to hide buttons entirely.
validationRules.showDot: If true, dotList is used to render dot indicators. Requires dotList array with at least 1 item.
validationRules.showpagi: If true, pagination counter is displayed. Works independently of buttons and dots.
validationRules.dotList._key: Each dot item MUST have unique _key value. Typically sequential: '0', '1', '2', etc.
validationRules.BiconFont: Must be 'font_awesome' (for FA icons) or 'img' (for custom images). Controls how btnIcon1/btnIcon2 vs Ctmicon1/Ctmicon2 are interpreted.
validationRules.dotList.iconFonts: Must be 'font_awesome' (for FA icons) or 'img' (for custom images). Controls whether iconName or iconImage is used for each dot.
validationRules.pAriaLabel_nAriaLabel: REQUIRED when btntxt1 and btntxt2 are empty (icon-only buttons). Screen readers need these for accessibility.
validationRules.AniDuration: Must be numeric string (milliseconds) or empty string. Valid: '3000', '5000', ''. Invalid: '3s', 3000 (number type).
validationRules.dotList.length: Should match the number of slides in connected carousel for 1:1 dot-to-slide mapping. Mismatch causes confusing UX.

warnings: CRITICAL: carouselId must EXACTLY match the ID set in the target carousel block. Case-sensitive! 'product-carousel' ≠ 'Product-Carousel'
Don't set both carobtn=false and showDot=false and showpagi=false - this creates an invisible/useless block with no controls
When using BiconFont='img', ensure Ctmicon1 and Ctmicon2 have valid image URLs. Empty URLs will show broken image icons
When using dotList with iconFonts='img', ensure all iconImage objects have valid URLs. Missing images break visual consistency
AniDuration (border animation) only applies to dotstyle='style-1'. Setting it for style-2 has no effect (tooltips don't animate borders)
tooltipDir applies to horizontal dotLayout, vtooltipDir applies to vertical dotLayout. Using wrong one has no effect
btnSpace creates gap between prev/next buttons. If too large on mobile, buttons may overflow viewport. Use responsive values (120 desktop → 40 mobile)
Pagination (showpagi) auto-updates with carousel slide changes. Don't try to manually set current page - it's controlled by carousel JavaScript
Active dot border (style-1) animates over AniDuration milliseconds. If carousel autoplay speed is 5000ms but AniDuration is 3000ms, animation finishes early (awkward pause). Sync these values!
If dotList has 5 items but carousel has 8 slides, dots won't map correctly (dots 6-8 won't exist). Always match counts.
When btntxt1/btntxt2 are empty, icon-only buttons render. Without pAriaLabel/nAriaLabel, screen readers announce 'button' with no context (accessibility fail)
iconimageSize ('thumbnail', 'medium', 'large', 'full') is a WordPress image size, not a pixel value. Use dimgSize to control display size in pixels
tooltiparrow=true shows CSS arrow on tooltip. If arrowColor doesn't match totipBgcolor, arrow will be a different color (usually unintended visual bug)
commonMistakes: Typo in carouselId - carousel doesn't respond to remote controls (most common mistake)
Forgetting _key in dotList items - causes React key warnings and potential rendering bugs
Using AniDuration='3s' instead of '3000' - must be milliseconds as string, not CSS time units
Setting iconName to icon class with 'fa' prefix in iconFonts='img' mode - won't render, need iconImage URL instead
Using dimgSize larger than dotSize - image overflows dot circle, breaks layout
Not setting responsive values for btnSpace - buttons too wide apart on mobile, break to two rows
Mixing tooltipDir (horizontal) with vertical dotLayout - tooltip direction ignored, falls back to default
Creating dotList with different icon types (some font_awesome, some img) - inconsistent visual appearance, avoid unless intentional
Forgetting to set pAriaLabel/nAriaLabel when creating icon-only buttons - fails WCAG accessibility
Setting showpagi=true but leaving sliderInd empty - pagination shows as '3' with no separator or total count (confusing)
Using style-2 dots without setting label - tooltips appear empty on hover (bad UX)
Copying dotList from another carousel but not updating _key values - duplicate keys cause rendering issues
bestPractices: Always use descriptive, unique carouselId values (e.g., 'product-gallery-main', 'testimonial-homepage', 'team-about-us') to avoid conflicts and aid debugging
Set ARIA labels (pAriaLabel, nAriaLabel) even when buttons have text - improves accessibility and screen reader context
Match AniDuration to carousel autoplay speed for seamless visual progress feedback (both 5000ms = perfect sync)
Use responsive sizing for all elements (dotSize, iconSize, btnSpace, rbtnpadding) to ensure good UX on all devices
Keep dotList count in sync with carousel slide count - add/remove dots when carousel slides change
Use style-1 dots for simple, clean navigation (e.g., product galleries, image sliders)
Use style-2 dots with tooltips when slides have distinct identities (e.g., team members, testimonials) - labels provide context
For icon-only buttons, use large iconSize (24px+ desktop, 20px+ mobile) to meet touch target requirements
When using custom image icons (BiconFont='img'), optimize images to <50KB each for fast loading
Use WordPress 'thumbnail' size (150×150) for dot iconImage - perfect for small icons, fast loading, then control display size with dimgSize
Set tooltiparrow=false for cleaner tooltip look, or true with matching arrowColor for polished appearance
Use vertical dotLayout for sidebar navigation (place remote block in narrow column next to carousel)
Use horizontal dotLayout for below-carousel navigation (centered, full-width placement)
For minimalist designs, use pagination-only (carobtn=false, showDot=false, showpagi=true) - clean progress indicator
Test on mobile devices - touch targets should be 44×44px minimum (WCAG 2.5.5 AAA), 24×24px acceptable for secondary controls
Use uppercase typography (textTransform: 'uppercase') with letter-spacing (0.5-1px) for button text to improve readability
Keep sliderInd simple (' / ', ' of ', '-') - fancy separators like '→' or emojis may not render consistently across fonts
accessibilityNotes: ARIA Labels (pAriaLabel, nAriaLabel) are REQUIRED when buttons have no text (btntxt1='', btntxt2='') - screen readers need descriptive context
Use semantic, descriptive ARIA labels: 'Go to previous product' (good) vs 'Previous' (okay) vs 'Prev' (too brief)
Active dot state should have sufficient color contrast (3:1 ratio minimum) between active and inactive states for visual distinction
Touch targets for buttons and dots should be 44×44px minimum (WCAG 2.5.5 Level AAA), 24×24px acceptable for Level A (secondary controls)
Keyboard navigation: Carousel remote should be operable via keyboard (Tab to focus buttons, Enter/Space to activate) - handled by browser default button behavior
Don't rely on color alone - use multiple visual cues (size, icon change, border) for active dot state
Pagination text (e.g., '3 of 8') should have 4.5:1 contrast ratio with background (WCAG AA standard for text)
If using tooltips (style-2), ensure tooltip text has 4.5:1 contrast ratio with tooltip background
Consider prefers-reduced-motion: Users with vestibular disorders may prefer AniDuration='' (no border animation)
Screen reader announcements: Carousel JavaScript should announce slide changes via ARIA live regions - remote block just controls, carousel handles announcements
performanceConsiderations: Custom image icons (BiconFont='img', iconFonts='img') add HTTP requests - optimize images to <50KB each, use WebP format if possible
Use WordPress thumbnail size (150×150) for iconImage - pre-generated, optimized, fast loading
Limit dotList to actual slide count - don't create 50 dots for 5 slides (unnecessary DOM bloat)
AniDuration animations are CSS-based (low overhead) - safe to use on all devices
Tooltips (style-2) use CSS positioning, not JavaScript - minimal performance impact
Pagination auto-updates use lightweight JavaScript - negligible overhead
If carousel has 100+ slides, consider pagination-only approach (no dots) - rendering 100 dots is DOM-heavy
FontAwesome icons (BiconFont='font_awesome') are icon fonts - single CSS file, better performance than individual images
Responsive values (md/sm/xs) generate CSS media queries - efficient, no JavaScript resize listeners
Active state changes (dot colors, button backgrounds) are CSS transitions - GPU-accelerated, smooth on mobile

troubleshooting.problem: Remote controls don't work - clicking buttons/dots has no effect
causes: Carousel JavaScript not loaded - check browser console for errors
Carousel block not present on same page as remote block
solutions: Inspect carousel block settings, copy exact carouselId value (case-sensitive), paste into remote block
Check browser console (F12) for JavaScript errors - fix any blocking errors
Ensure carousel and remote blocks are on same page - remote can't control carousels on different pages

troubleshooting.problem: Dots render but show no icons or images
causes: iconName empty string but iconFonts='font_awesome' (no icon specified)
iconImage.url empty but iconFonts='img' (no image URL)
FontAwesome not loaded on site (icon class doesn't render)
solutions: Set iconName to valid FontAwesome class (e.g., 'fas fa-star') when iconFonts='font_awesome'
Ensure iconImage has valid URL when iconFonts='img'
Check if FontAwesome CSS is loaded - view page source, search for 'font-awesome' - if missing, enqueue FA in theme

troubleshooting.problem: Border animation (style-1) doesn't animate or finishes too fast/slow
causes: AniDuration not set or invalid format ('3s' instead of '3000')
AniDuration much shorter/longer than carousel autoplay speed (bad sync)
solutions: Set AniDuration to milliseconds string: '5000' for 5 seconds
Match AniDuration to carousel autoplay speed (both 5000ms) for perfect sync

troubleshooting.problem: Tooltips (style-2) don't appear or appear in wrong direction
causes: tooltipDir set but dotLayout is vertical (should use vtooltipDir)
Tooltip CSS z-index conflict with other elements
label field empty in dotList items
solutions: Use tooltipDir for horizontal layout, vtooltipDir for vertical layout
Inspect element, check z-index - tooltip container should be high (9999)
Ensure every dotList item has label text for tooltip content

troubleshooting.problem: Buttons too wide apart on mobile, break to two rows
causes: btnSpace set to large desktop value (120px) without responsive mobile override
solutions: Set responsive btnSpace: {md: '120', sm: '80', xs: '40', unit: 'px'}

troubleshooting.problem: Pagination shows '3' with no total count
causes: showpagi=true but sliderInd empty (no separator defined)
solutions: Set sliderInd to separator: ' / ' or ' of ' - enables full pagination display

troubleshooting.problem: Custom image icons (dotList) too large or overflow dots
causes: dimgSize larger than dotSize (image bigger than container)
No dpadding set (image fills entire dot, no border visible)
solutions: Set dimgSize 10-15px smaller than dotSize (e.g., dotSize 60px, dimgSize 50px)
Add dpadding (5px recommended) for visible border/background around image

troubleshooting.problem: Active dot not visually distinct from inactive dots
causes: actdotBgtype or acticonColor not set (same colors as inactive state)
Insufficient color contrast between active/inactive states
solutions: Set actdotBgtype to contrasting color (e.g., inactive #e2e8f0 gray, active #3b82f6 blue)
Ensure 3:1 contrast ratio minimum for accessibility

integrationExamples.scenario: Product Image Gallery with Remote Controls
integrationExamples.setup: Create tpgb/tp-anything-carousel with carouselId='product-images', add 5 product image slides, create tp-carousel-remote below with carouselId='product-images', enable dots (showDot=true, style-1, 5 dots matching 5 slides)
integrationExamples.layout: Stack carousel above remote - carousel shows large product images, remote below shows horizontal dots for quick navigation
integrationExamples.benefits: Users can click dots to jump to specific product angle, border animation shows progress during autoplay

integrationExamples.setup: Create tpgb/tp-row with two tp-column blocks (70% and 30% widths), in 70% column add tp-carousel with carouselId='testimonials', in 30% column add tp-carousel-remote with carouselId='testimonials', enable vertical dots (dotLayout='vertical', style-2 tooltips with customer names)
integrationExamples.layout: Side-by-side - testimonial content (left 70%) and vertical dots (right 30% sidebar)
integrationExamples.benefits: Dots with customer name tooltips provide context, clicking dot jumps to that testimonial, vertical layout fits sidebar nicely

integrationExamples.scenario: Blog Post Slider with Progress Indicator
integrationExamples.setup: Create tp-carousel with 8 blog post slides, carouselId='blog-featured', create tp-carousel-remote with carouselId='blog-featured', disable buttons and dots (carobtn=false, showDot=false), enable pagination only (showpagi=true, sliderInd=' of ')
integrationExamples.layout: Minimalist - carousel auto-rotates, pagination shows '2 of 8' below for progress awareness
integrationExamples.benefits: Clean design, no manual controls (auto-rotate only), user sees progress without UI clutter

integrationExamples.scenario: Team Member Carousel with Photo Dots
integrationExamples.setup: Create tp-carousel with 4 team member bio slides, carouselId='team-about', add tp-carousel-remote with carouselId='team-about', create 4 dotList items with iconFonts='img', iconImage URLs pointing to team member headshots (thumbnail size 150×150), style-2 tooltips with names/titles
integrationExamples.layout: Carousel shows full bio, dots below show circular headshot thumbnails (60×60 display size), hover shows name tooltip
integrationExamples.benefits: Visual dot navigation - users see who they're selecting, intuitive UX, photo thumbnails more engaging than generic icons

integrationExamples.scenario: Full-Width Hero Slider with Gradient Buttons
integrationExamples.setup: Create full-width tp-carousel (align='full') with 3 hero slides, carouselId='hero-home', add tp-carousel-remote with carouselId='hero-home', create icon-only buttons (btntxt1='', btntxt2='', large icons 28px), purple gradient backgrounds, circular shape (radius 50px), positioned left/right edges
integrationExamples.layout: Buttons float over hero slider edges, no dots (visual distraction on hero), no pagination (only 3 slides)
integrationExamples.benefits: Elegant hero navigation, gradient buttons match brand, large touch targets, ARIA labels for accessibility

relatedBlocks: tpgb/tp-carousel (Anything Carousel) - Target carousel block this remote controls, set matching carouselId
tpgb/tp-row and tpgb/tp-column - Layout blocks for positioning remote next to/below carousel
tpgb/tp-testimonials - Often paired with carousel remote for testimonial navigation
tpgb/tp-product-listing - WooCommerce product carousels can use remote controls

carouselIdMatchingGuide.step1: In your carousel block (tpgb/tp-carousel or tpgb/tp-anything-carousel), find the 'Carousel ID' setting
carouselIdMatchingGuide.step3: Copy this EXACT value (case-sensitive, spaces matter)
carouselIdMatchingGuide.step4: In carousel remote block, paste the exact value into 'carouselId' attribute
carouselIdMatchingGuide.step5: Test by clicking prev/next buttons or dots - carousel should respond
carouselIdMatchingGuide.troubleshooting: If not working, inspect both blocks in editor, compare carouselId values character-by-character for typos

horizontal.whenToUse: Below carousel, full-width placement, standard galleries/sliders
horizontal.tooltipDirection: Use tooltipDir (top/bottom make sense for horizontal row)
horizontal.spacing: dotSpace creates horizontal gaps between dots
horizontal.advantages: Familiar UX (most carousels use horizontal dots), fits below content naturally

vertical.whenToUse: Sidebar navigation next to carousel, space-constrained layouts, testimonials with names
vertical.tooltipDirection: Use vtooltipDir (left/right make sense for vertical column)
vertical.spacing: dotSpace creates vertical gaps between dots
vertical.advantages: Saves horizontal space, good for tall carousels with many slides, allows longer tooltips (names, titles)

style-1.appearance: Dots with animated border that fills around active dot over AniDuration milliseconds
style-1.whenToUse: Product galleries, image sliders, simple navigation where slides don't have distinct identities
style-1.advantages: Visual progress indicator (border animation shows time until next slide), clean aesthetic
style-1.configuration: Set AborderColor (border color), AniDuration (animation milliseconds, sync with carousel autoplay)

style-2.appearance: Dots with tooltips that appear on hover, showing label text
style-2.whenToUse: Testimonials (show customer names), team members (show names/titles), any carousel where slides have distinct identities
style-2.advantages: Context via tooltips, user knows what they're clicking before clicking
style-2.configuration: Set label in each dotList item (tooltip content), tooltipDir or vtooltipDir (tooltip position), tooltiparrow (show/hide arrow), totipTypo/totipColor/totipBgcolor (tooltip styling)
